comments.body: Rose Gold is not a naturally occurring mineral, but actually an alloy of gold and copper.
Like to see redstone cable
yeah, why not
Or red gold, something from Norse myths

I think it would be cool to be able to make Rose Gold armor and tools that are like Regular gold but way more durable. Maybe it could be stronger than Diamonds but weaker than Netherite of course. Finally some actually useful gold.

Rose gold is an alloy of gold and copper, which is an upcoming new resource. This could be how to obtain it rather than the nether ores.

Rose gold armor could attract piglins, and rose gold (when bartered) could give you a different set of items, such as higher-tier tools or altogether new items.

Rose gold tools could be a bit more durable than regular gold tools, but just as efficient and easy to enchant. 

Rose gold could be the way Mojang brings back the Enchanted Golden Apple (or Notch apple) recipe in the game.
The Rose Gold Armor should also be more durable than Gold armor so players feel more safer in the Nether.
it could be just like gold armor, except just as durable as iron, not more protective than gold.
byrik
I love my dogs and I don’t want them to be hurt in battle so we need Armor for them
I agree. Also make some for new axolotl pets. (Or at least an item that lets them walk on land)
Please specify that it is a Java Parity in the title. Might get more votes that way.

No, having Bedrock Parity in the title is correct, since we're talking a change to Java for parity with Bedrock.

And yes, it's been a year since this feedback was posted. Let's get some more support!
Thank you all for your votes. Like and Share so we can get more votes.

Instead of having the arrow place a torch on impact, what if the arrow turned into a torch variant upon collision with the ground? It would work similar to a normal torch, but it would be a block that looks like the arrow stuck into the wall.
What is it also stuck to mobs????
Yes. we need this.
these would be really useful in the new update!
I would love this classic mod feature to be added to the game!!

This is an awesome idea especially with the new caves and cliffs addition. When you get hit from out of nowhere it would be nice to shoot an arrow in the general direction to see, if just for a brief moment, what is trying to kill you. EVERYBODY VOTE FOR THIS ONE PLEASE!!!!
I want this in the game so bad! Lighting up areas that are out of reach is nice! Why don't this has more likes?!
I would like to prevent mobs from spawning in areas while I am at a safe distance.
Great way to enhance exploring large caves. It could be created with a torch, an arrow, and a slimeball. It could also be that extra use people have been wanting from the fletching table.
Combine Arrows with Torchflowers with a Fletching table to create these ‘Torch Arrows’. Projectile lighting in caves would be a great advantage to discovering new spots in the far away dark areas.

Potions are for passive effects, meaning you don't need to activate it

 

It should be a debuff, randomly teleporting you for ten seconds
If you put a Fermented Spider Eye in the potion, it should randomly teleport the target without the control of the ability.
This would add another use to ender pearls since they have been replaced in use by fireworks rockets and elytras
Alternatively, how about a throwable potion that takes you to the location it lands, also allowing you to create tipped arrows for the same effect? 20 blocks distance is good for balance purposes

I was thinking that this potion does nothing unless you are attacked by projectiles, where it would then teleport you out of the way. It may also do the same with non-projectile attacks, although I am not sure

Potions of Teleportation II would give you a sort of nausea effect except the overlay is for Nether Portals. If in the Overworld, it would transport you to the Nether, and vice versa. This would be a one time thing, making it so you would have to collect more materials in the Nether if you wanted to get back. I think this would add an interesting aspect to the game

Way too overpowered, especially for Bedrock Edition, where you can use a spawn egg on any spawner to turn it into a spawner for that mob. You're opening the door to incredibly easy creeper farms, wither skeleton farms, witch farms, enderman farms, maybe even ghast farms...
maybe it can only be on swords found pre-enchanted in end cities
Since this enchantment is so OP, maybe it cost a lot of experience, a special sword, and make it only possible after you defeat the ender dragon and wither.
End cities would still be after the Ender Dragon
sorry, I forgot the new overpowered possibilities.
To overpowered.  Also, what about enderdragons, withers, snow golems, and iron golems?
they wouldn't drop them.
This is way to op but i would love it. It has to be a treasure enchantment though, and not traded by villagers
I love it but that's way too op for vanilla Minecraft.

It should lower the maximum durability of the weapon to 3 points and remove/disable unbreaking on it.

Let it be found very rarely on wooden swords only (so at times it could easily break without the effect even happening) in end cities over 100 000 blocks away from spawn.

That’s the most op thing I’ve ever heard. Literally I kill a single skeleton and find a dungeon and now I have a skeleton grinder. I kill a single anything and find a dungeon I have an infinite farm of any mob in Minecraft also there are spawners in the nether. If this were to be added it would need to be balanced so I propose making it a hoe enchantment as hoes are related to farming which relates to life and also to make the drop chance very small and the enchantment only found in woodland mansions. Also an alternative to making this an enchantment would be to make a specially crafted weapon (it would be expensive) to accomplish this goal. Maybe it could be crafted out of a nether star, bamboo, 3 enchanted apples, two diamond blocks, and the ender dragon egg
I had the exact same idea!  But I think it should have a 50% chance of dropping a spawn egg. When It doesnt drop a spawn egg it would drop nothing.
Sounds really fun, but I don't think it would make a great addition to Minecraft.

I think its great that we're getting these weird armour bits i.e the Elytra and turtle helmet but I think 20 blocks is a bit OP.

Maybe the height should be like the Bow. Holding jump for longer gets you higher and 20 is the highest you can go?

not sure but I would love this! :)

It’s an awesome idea but what about just like an enchantment or combining a leaping potion with any boots and get a super jump ability, I think this would be less broken. Like for pvp and you can break your fall by using a shield and pvp would be sick, id be playing pvp with friends way more I think this is a great idea.
I like the idea, but I am not sure how it would be useful

Great idea !!!!
the skeleton twist on it doesn’t really make sense

Great idea !!!!
the skeleton twist on it doesn’t really make sense

Hello, I'm Some Animal: This is a series of new arrows that many believe should be added to Minecraft. The modifications I will be adding to the arrows to balence them will be measured by the percentages. The basic arrow will always be 100% in each category. These new arrows can be used in both a crossbow and bow unless specifically said otherwise.
Draw time- how long the arrow takes to be drawn.
Damage- how much damage it does.
Range- How far it can go before hitting the ground.
Speed- How long it will take for it to reach it's destination.
Accuracy- This is the only type of modifier that the regular arrow is not at 100% the regular arrow is at 85%-90% from what I can tell.
All of these modifications will be affected by how long the player takes to draw the bow, or what enchantments are on the crossbow, these are just baseline stats.
Arrow of Teleportation: This a arrow would be an upgrade to the Enderpearl, having more accuracy and longer reach, and a faster arrival. It would be crafted with one Arrow and an enderpearl.
Draw Time: 200%
Damage(To yourself, based on the enderpearl doing 100%): 200%
Range: 250%
Speed: 200%
Accuracy: 100%
Sorry fo hyjackking your posts :b

I think that some way to throw an ender pearl much further and with much more precision would be a great addition to the game as the ender pearl’s mechanics have been pretty lacklustre since it’s addition to the game...

So I think the idea of an ender arrow would fit that quite well, or some other form of launcher...
As much as I’ve seen people say that it would be pointless for an ender arrow as the ender pearl itself follows much the same “lobbed path”, the parabolic path that an ender pearl follows is no where near as far, nor can it be as precise as an arrow...

That being said I think one pearl should equate to one arrow, otherwise the effects of an ender pearl can just be multiplied eight times over just by placing a few arrows around it...
If you hit a mob with it, it should deal large knockback, so you don’t just get hit by the mob as soon as you teleport.

One minor problem, this means that you will always retrieve the arrow if you don’t hit a mob, so maybe it should disappear whenever it hits anything.

Also skeletons shouldn’t use them, because they don’t want to fight at close range.
if you shoot an entity it should teleport them randomly
The the saxophone should have bamboo in the recipe because bamboo makes reeds which saxophones have
No saxophone should have sugar canes in the recipe for the reeds because sugar canes were previously called reeds.
Maybe add double bass, guitar, and/or trumpet and trombone, as you have every other part of a basic string orchestra and the saxophone by itself.
Also, how would cellos be portable?
we have a instrument: goat horn
Great Idea!
I would say: Make them stackable up to 16
I've read on the Minecraft forums that potions can be stacked up to 16 but this only applies in future editions of Java, I hope Mojang will add this feature in the bedrock edition
I think it would be cool if potions could be combined into one potion. It would take up less space, but then you wouldn't be able to separate the potions if you only wanted to use one.
This needs to go in bedrock :/ it would be depressing if it didn't.

I would love to be able to have stackable potions in Bedrock. I think there would be some balancing needed to ensure that potions don't end up being overpowered. Maybe a smaller stack size and a reasonable cooldown per depending on the potion. Another benefit of stackable potions would be ease of sorting with hopper filters; my OCD results in way too much time spent manually sorting unsackable items that lack easy filtering options.

Sometimes it feels hard to justify using potions in regular gameplay because they take up so much inventory space. Allowing them to stack up to 16 like honey would make it much more reasonable to bring several potions of fire resistance on your Nether adventures.
came here to say this id even be okay with a stack of 3 but 16 seems fair
I was going to post the same, so i give you a vote
definitely true i never use potions because they take up too much inventory space and are annoying to make
This would be pointless with the infinity enchantment unless you use potion laced arrows.

This was removed from the game..

Use your off-hand slot or an infinity bow..

Dork and Tucat have a point, however The idea of the quiver could easily be expanded via It’s own slot and a New assortment of arrows, like Combustion arrows for small explosions, and Piercing arrows to hit multiple mobs. The quiver could only be used for Potion or specialized Arrows... while the off-hand does do this, switching arrow types is rather slow, So a quiver would Help make Minecraft better, especially If we had more arrow types.

I love this idea and get some what frustrated by the "Infinity" response.

There are several arrows in the game that do different things. Which arrow you want might be situational. Having a quiver will allow me to equip a variety of different magical arrows to use as I need them.

Hope they add this. Thanks for the sug.
I like this idea, especially if you have a Bow with Mending on it, since you can't have Mending and Infinity
Love this idea! And I saw the ideas of explosive arrows down below which would be POG!!!

One way it could run Is by add other off-hand slot at right exclusive for quiver where u could access by the right button just like its explained

Other way is using one off-hand slot to access but maybe could be a problem with all other items players usually have already on it

And last way is add quiver and bow on one item and by click scrolling roll access to the inventory

Any way quiver i think is a good addition to the all battle system
Cool idea! I think there should also be key binds to switch arrows in the quiver on a whim. Something like R+(1- 5) to change the slot of arrows and switch them quickly.

Practically, the quiver should be used to easily and efficiently swap arrows while on the fly, so I would suggest that if you put the quiver anywhere in your inventory, and you pull out a bow and pull the string back, than your hotbar swaps to the quiver bar temporarily while you aim, now you can choose your arrows with ease and it takes up no space in your hotbar.

Running out of arrows has never been a big problem for me, and I don't even use infinity! So the purpose of the quiver should be to control what type of arrows you are shooting.
Minecraft did plan add it but was discontinued

This could be very interesting mabey for some other designs you could have certain potions give the armor effects, you could have tons of designs like the banner designs and allow them to be combined just like banners
Non so se sei aggiornato, ma negli snapshot della 1.16 la smitingh table funziona, ma solo negli ultimi

I know that 1.16 gave it the ability to turn Diamond items to Netherite items, but I find that to be a pretty niche and late-game usage. This way can keep that ability, while giving the table additional uses.

I have seen a feedback thread where somebody had a very thorough, but fantastic concept where you could customize armor with emeralds, gold, and etc. A game called "Cube World", had customization like this in their alpha. I'd link it here but can't find it in my activity. Y'all should be able to find it though with the search bar pretty easily though.
I swear i already posted a very similar idea but i couldn't find it so yeah... Hope the devs see this post! (So it gets implemented)
That's a great idea but, there should be like 2 more designs or something. And it should also work with other stuff like weapons, tools, and elytra, ect.

Here are some other designs I think would be cool.

  • +Leaves =  A Leaf Pattern
  • +Creeper Head = Creeper Face
  • +Skeleton or Wither Skull = Skull Pattern
  • +Soul Sand = A Souls Face
  • + Iron Or Gold ingot = Gold or Iron Shoulder Pads and Knee Pads.
I want to just actually look like I am a knight or something rather then just a turtle. We all look like turtles!

I was about to submit something very similar, and in doing so add a use to the goat horns which is currently only good for...making a noise? Difference with mine is that these would provide subtle upgrades rather than just aesthetics, which I understand might be stepping on enchantings toes. For example, goat horns make a horned Viking helmet, providing extra knockback for all sprinting attacks. Leather creating a belt or bandolier, similar to yours. Bundles add a the cut quiver to the chestplate, improving bow and crossbow RoF (OP?). My jack-o’-lantern was going to give a full helmet design. Rabbit fur, makes a cloak that provides protection from the freezing effect. And finally copper blocks make copper lined armor, allows you to attract lightning during storms to enemies surrounding you, or to yourself, for whatever reason. This can easily break up the monotony of every player looking the same, as you said, and help you recognize which armors which in your chest full of samey looking enchanted armor. The bonuses they provide aren’t entirely necessary, actually different looking armors is amazing enough on its own and will do wonders for role playing as well, for those who are into that. My uploads keep vanishing for whatever reason so I’ll probably stick to comments now
Moved to proper category.
This needs more votes I was thinking the same thing.
Maybe they should add hoglin hide and you use that for the bed
I like your username...
Or instead of planks you could use the new "crying obsidian"
Well, since there is no day/night cycle in the Nether, there is no way to calculate how much time will pass when you wake up if you could sleep there, so not much use anyway.
good idea but we could do that with the respawn anchor make the beds are not explosive but spending the glowstone
I would like some of those mechanics but if they add it, the respawn anchor would no longer make sense in the game
Maybe basalt could be used to make stone tools? But I don't think basalt tools should be added.
Basalt tools could be slightly better than stone tools, and should be used by the wither skeletons as such. These tools could also be fire (not lava) resistant.
It makes sense. If we can build weapon and armor tiers in the Nether like this, it'll make more sense to live in the nether.
Also, I would vouch for basalt furnace/blast furnace crafting, and other stations that use stone with basalt. It'd be useful for a nether survival.

I expected this idea to feel like mod or crappy but wow your reasoning and logic is really great but there is an existing problem of progression in living in the nether since going through the forest then to the soul sand valley THEN to the nether fortress just to get some iron is a big travel but i doubt it matters.

  Just to keep the progression going why not add an alternative for iron? Any ideas?

When basalt is combined with quartz it could create regular cobblestone, similar to how cobblestone combined with quartz creates diorite. This would allow basalt to be made into stone tools and give quartz a use.

This would make upgrading to stone tier in the nether actually possible. If not difficult. Then if stone tools could be used to mine nether gold then you could trade for iron and obsidian in order to get back to the overworld.

I've been thinking about this a lot recently. I want to be able to play the game entirely in the nether without ever having to enter the overworld. Currently the nether provides the progression of wood -> gold -> netherite-upgraded, however the only way to bridge the gap between these is by finding and looting a nether fortress. I'm fine with this being the solution for diamonds, and I actually like how iron gets skipped since gold usually gets skipped in the overworld. However I feel like there should be a natural way to get from wood to gold using only what can be found in the nether. I think Basalt could be the solution to this, with it being a slightly better version of stone that is pretty much useless, however if you don't have access to the overworld it suddenly becomes critical.
Here's a idea I had for the Basalt pickaxe:
Basically it could replace cobblestone in crafting recipes that requires cobblestone
I think this would make nether survival more fair in the Nether but still fairly challenging
I think this would make nether survival more fair in the Nether but still fairly challenging
Also, I believe Basalt should be used to make furnaces so that you can smelt items such as ancient debris when doing something such as a nether survival challenge.

Nether Gold Ore should not be mineable by wood pickaxes, instead implement basalt tools (stone level) that can break nether gold ore.

Basalt pickaxe, axe, shovel, hoe, sword

Nether-based tool blocks would be neat but there is a simpler solution. Basalt as a crafting ingredient in replacement of any recipe using Cobblestone and Smooth Basalt replacing Stone. This includes furnace, blast furnace, stonecutter, grinder, brewing stand.

Same level as Stone tools and weapon, could even just be a Stone type tool with an nbt tag of Basalt in order to have a different texture.

Everyone wants to live in the Nether now and this adds the flavor and the ability to do so!

As most have been saying, basalt should be used as the alternative to cobblestone in crafting. This could help make gold collection more efficient before you can get the fortune enchantment because you can smelt the gold ore to get the bars. You need cobblestone to craft a furnace, but basalt could be a solid alternative. Wood and gold tools burn out quickly, so stone tools made from basalt are another good alternative solution. In the crafting recipe for the grindstone, you need smooth stone, so smooth basalt could be used instead.

The only problem that I see is that basalt is found in the soul sand valley, which is VERY DANGEROUS. Gold should still be mined by a wood pick, but basalt is still a good alternative nonetheless, even if it takes a lot of effort to get to that point. Of course if you are in the Nether from the Overworld, you have at least iron tools and armor, so you can skip that crucial stage. In the instance that you want to start in the Nether, though, then this should be taken into consideration. Remember: Make the Nether hospitable, but not livable; add all the necessities, but make it a challenge to get them, like basalt.
With this brand new basalt (or basalt based stone) tools only nether survivals would be more interesting to play and watch! But I'm not a fan of basalt armor. Just tools.
We already have netherite ore in the nether that adds new armor and tools
good job, they added netherite
This should just be an alternative crafting recipe for arrows, not a new item.
Bow enchantments like power 5 make normal arrows very powerful, adding iron tipped arrows could defeat the purpose of Power enchantment?
it could be an upgrade that is applied using the fletching table
please Mojang, flint is suffer to find. and some nuggets to make an arrow is make more senses.

I don't think it should be crafted into a different arrowhead item just use a nuggets in a fletching table.
Flint, iron nuggets, gold nuggets, copper nuggets. maybe Prismarine tips,

instead of a stick the only items it could be replaced with are blaze rods, and breeze rods.

I don't think anymore items need to be added for this there's already some that makes sense in a fantasy way, but if it's just like a mod then it's not going to be added right so it has to fit vinyl.

Berry Jam would also need sugar to sweeten it, and maybe even to be cooked in a furnace before it is made. It could maybe even have a cooldown period before it is fully done after being cooked.

The bread with jam idea would be good but I think it should maybe be a little different in recipe and result. Maybe for the 2 bread and 1 made jam in a jar you would result in 18 slices of jam covered bread slices and the empty jar? Just food for thought ;)

Why stop at sweet berries?
Apple Jam, Chorus Jam, and Melon Jam too!
A crafting recipe or furnace might not make too much sense, but luckily were also getting the barrel, which could be used to craft preservers, which could convert the fruits and sugar into jam.
Sweet berry jam

i think that it would be a great idea, as berries are not really a good food item, i also think that berry bushes needs a balancement, instead of being planted from berries, they would have to be sheared, it's also annoying to accidentally plant a berry bush while trying to eat a berry, berries are really an unbalanced food source
We could use berry jam to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.

Berries are junk food (low hunger and saturation points), and you can collect them in large amounts.

That`s why they need to be an ingredient for more complex food.

 

6 berries + 1 sugar = berry jam

3 berries + 3 melon slice = fruit drink

 

My support!

I was thinking 2 berries + 1 sugar = Sweetberry Jam

Sweetberry Jam + bread = Sweetberry Scones 

 

Regardless, we need Jelly!

Berries with sugar from sugar cane (or honey) and a glass bottle could yield jam. But berries would also be great for making pies, since we already have a pie template with pumpkin pie. None of these would require new items but a good use of existing items.
Also a golden berry jam! I think one bread and one made jam could produce 8 bread with jam. Also while we are talking about bread creations, sandwiches with meat like mutton and ham!

I started a new game in a spruce forest. There was not a lot of grass to gather seeds for wheat but there was a lot of sweet berry bushes.

Food was sparse and eating the berries took a long time to get back to full hunger level.

It would be good to have an upgraded (cooked) version of sweet berries and jam would be a good idea.
Maybe make the dagger's cool down very small, but not deal too much damage per hit.
Being able to use 2 daggers at a time perhaps alternating between them while the other cools down would be an interesting fighting technique.
and they should be short enough to throw
This should totally make it into the game :D
What would be really cool is a redstone infused dagger varient

I tottally support this Idea, but make sure not to make it to OP, because the only reasonable way to craft one is crafted like a sword - 1 iron / diamond, etc. because then if it did the same amount of damage or something, everyone wouldn't use swords, and one bad thing is you won't need a crafting table, other combinations are also not reasonable though, could like shovels, or something.
Haha you posted on my birthday!
Y E S
Throwing would be EPIC!!
OR maybe it can't be crafted my has to be found in a chest somewhere, and could come with a new structure
OR maybe it can't be crafted my has to be found in a chest somewhere, and could come with a new structure

Yes, this logically makes sense.  But I'm not sure this is a change they should make at this point.  People rely on the mechanism of how trees grow to do various things, and I bet this would change too much.
Excess formatting removed, headline clarified ("trees" is too generic.)
WolveReigner is correct here; your idea is basically already in the game.
Yup

Different Colored sand is a real thing. There is pretty much every color of sand in the rainbow, though it is very rare. There is pink sand from coral, black sand from volcanoes, green sand from a mineral called olivine, orange from a type of limestone, purple, brown. It goes on and on. I think this is a great idea!
Concrete Powder has sixteen different dye colors, and it has a texture similar to sand, so this is really in the game already.

I feel like this is a gr8 idea despite those that feel like co crete powder is a supplement. The reason why is for the grainy texture of a sandstone. Concrete powder is flare and dull once it's hardened while sandstone is rather lovely and to be limited on to the white and red colors is unfortunate. In fact is love a more golden textured sandstone. Perhaps a recipe involving gold nuggets.

Taking into account the addition of Concrete Powder, the main issue with it is that it can't be used anywhere near water, that is why I think it is a good idea to add some new colors to Sand while also providing new ways to craft and obtain those new items.

Using a Stonecutter, transforming Sandstone into 1/2 blocks of Sand.

And/Or by

Making an anvil fall onto Sandstone, transforming it into Sand.

Those will allow us to craft the new variants.

  • White Sand, obtainable by using the methods above with Calcite.
  • Pink Sand, could be found in the ground and on beaches of Coral reefs or crafted using Brain Corals, Brain Coral blocks or Brain Coral Fans.
  • Mossy Sand blocks, a green-ish version of sand, found in Rivers and craftable using moss, vines or maybe kelp with Sand blocks on a Crafting Table.
  • Dark Red Sand, a red-ish/brown-ish version of Red Sand found in Mesa rivers.

All of those variant could also result in White, Pink, Lime and Red Glass blocks once smelted, same for Red Sand turning into Orange Glass blocks.

A Rooted version of those could be a great addition in the Wild Update too, not affected by gravity and craftable using Mangrove roots or Dead bushes or obtainable by growing a Mangrove tree over Sand blocks.

Like someone mentioned earlier, there’s plenty of different kinds of sand IRL. We need different kinds of sands that can be used near water without being converted into concrete blocks.

Red sand could be crafted with sand and raw iron (rust)
Regular sand could be a husk drop (yes, it should be renewable, so we don’t have to destroy deserts to make glass)
Black sand could be made from basalt or blackstone
Pink sand comes from coral irl but most coral sand ends up white - I say pink sand could come from granite
Green sand is a tougher sell. Perhaps from emeralds?
Brown sand could come from coarse dirt, or just dirt - it could be called silt. And while combining gravel and dirt makes coarse dirt, perhaps combining silt and dirt could make fine dirt, or loam, or fertile dirt? Which, when used to make farmland, could grow crops faster… and have a moderate chance of turning into regular dirt after having a mature crop harvested from it.
I’ve never heard of natural purple sand but that can easily be made with amethyst shards.
Other, more artificial colors could come from breaking down stained glass, or perhaps crafting sand with dye.

Having beaches with different kinds of sands would be neat - and would help organically hint at the existence of other colors of sands in the game.
Black volcanic sand would be right at home in the nether, seeing as there are no surface volcanoes in the overworld.
it will be fun
Mayb we can upgade our golden gear into silvered gear
Idk about the moon part tho, seems quite a bit abused for the speed tho I like the idea of durability regen but it has to be really slow

10/10 will be disappointed if this doesn't make it.

 

I'll mod it in if it doesn't make it.
Great idea! Although not very practical, it would make a great decoration block.
Yes! An awesome decoration item, but if it was also functional?! It would be awesome to use it while it is a placed item

Really neat, and I thought this would be inevitable after they announced it.

Ah, I can't wait to spy on the moon in Minecraft!
I would love yo see the telescope be usable still. I can see putting them on towers, and using them to find raiders and other mobs.

es una gran idea
Although I personally Don't like the Crafting Method, I think this idea is Brilliant
